intro: Adenocarpus hispanicus subsp. gredensis, commonly known as the Gredense thornvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its legume fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, thriving in Mediterranean climates. It features compound leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. This subspecies is notable for its spiny stems and is often found in dry, open habitats.
